Grillface.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] The old facemasks of the Eradian guards were forged from raw magma, and enchanted to remain searingly hot, so as to brand the wearer eternally with the mark of Rodoroc's elite.
Grillface.name: Grillface

Bovine Killer.lore: This helmet was worn long ago by an infamous assassin who plagued Bovemist sites for decades. It was crafted of the still-bloody skin of their most prized and worshiped cows.
Bovine Killer.name: Bovine Killer

Obsolescent Panoply.lore: A silhouette of forgotten strength, its essence lingering like a half remembered dream. It no longer boasts the sharpness it once had, yet the stories etched into its very being refuse to fade.
Obsolescent Panoply.name: Obsolescent Panoply

The Forgery.lore: While only a mockery of the original product, this line of helmets became wildly popular before legal disputes and safety concerns halted production.
The Forgery.name: The Forgery

Outlandish Replica Face Mask of Legendar.lore: This perfect-to-the-point-of-indistinguishability replica mask of Herbert von Legendary's face, painstakingly crafted by Corkus's most powerful machines with only the most expensive materials and featuring real moustache hair plucked from Doctor Legendary's face, is desperately handed over to attempt to placate those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, gone even further beyond spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge, pushed onward to prove that they will not stop spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge, and then ultimately garnered an unhealthy obsession for spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
Outlandish Replica Face Mask of Legendar.name: Outlandish Replica Face Mask of Legendary Victory

Pelier.lore: Occasional whisperings can be heard by the wearers of this stone mask, reforged from a phylactery of souls. Although not dangerous, staring into the eyes of the mask can bring fear of one's soul being trapped within.
Pelier.name: Pelier

majorIds.Napalm: +Napalm: Fire Creep increases Arrow Bomb damage by +15%, but deals 15 times the self-damage and lowers velocity. Scorched Earth radius is increased and deals +65%.

majorIds.Fright or Flight: +Fright or Flight: Plays spooky tunes.

Dune Beast Jaw.lore: "We're trying to dig up history, not horrors! What is wrong with this province?!"  -Excavator Vade, WynnExcavation Site A Director
Dune Beast Jaw.name: Dune Beast Jaw

Cephalothorax.lore: "...Most of their vital organs, however, are located in the bulbous abdomen. If you've enough crushing force with your weapon, it may be a quicker alternative for the kill. ..." -Admiral Aegis' Guide To Nivla Threats, Chapter 3
Cephalothorax.name: Cephalothorax

Spectre.lore: The dark spectres of the decayed forests have created an insidious helmet to drain the spirit of those who wear it, and become servants to their dark whims. Many have fallen to its allure.
Spectre.name: Spectre

Greatbird Eyrie.lore: Sculpted by searing flames and dazzling light, in the years since the Fracturing the Greatbirds' nest has developed a blinding glow. It has both immense power and volatility, yet seems to hold a hidden strength for one who can tame its spirit.
Greatbird Eyrie.name: Greatbird Eyrie

Black Ripper.lore: "The skeletons at Ancient Nemract are rotted! is it even physically possible to rot a bone?" -Laen, Nemract Librarian
Black Ripper.name: Black Ripper

Obsidian-Framed Helmet.lore: Made of dark minerals and adorned with pure obsidian, this ornately-crafted helmet is given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
Obsidian-Framed Helmet.name: Obsidian-Framed Helmet

Stifling Spores.lore: The beauty of this peculiar grotto takes your breath away. Unfortunately, its spores do too...

majorIds.Plague: +Plague: Poisoned mobs spread their poison to nearby mobs.

Stifling Spores.name: Stifling Spores

Aphotic.lore: This dark relic was found at the very bottom of the deepest trench of the ocean. It drains all light surrounding it, blinding everything in a strange abyssal darkness.
Aphotic.name: Aphotic

majorIds.Festive Spirit: +Festive Spirit: Plays wintery tunes.

Shinespark.lore: There have been many attempts to create a reliable power system in Llevigar, and this plasma-charged helmet was reforged from a notable prototype.
Shinespark.name: Shinespark

Dark Matter֎.lore: It permeates around you, so subtly, enveloping your very being with a shroud on the cusp of impalpability.  Nothing can affect you now - the incorporeal hiding in plain sight.

majorIds.Intangible: +Intangible: The knockback you take is drastically reduced, and reflected damage deals large knockback.

Dark Matter֎.name: Dark Matter֎

Conflagrate.lore: Donning this helmet sears your mind with images of a world on fire. These blistering thoughts pressure you to make that world a reality.
Conflagrate.name: Conflagrate

Shawl of Gaea.lore: Despite being thin enough to blow away in the wind, this mineral-blended shawl holds the force of a supervolcano within its soft fabric.
Shawl of Gaea.name: Shawl of Gaea

Treasured Diamond Mask of Legendary Vict.lore: This excessively ornate to-the-point-of-being-wasteful decorative mask, laser-cut from a meter's worth of pure diamond, is given to those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, gone even further beyond spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge, and then pushed onward to prove that they will not stop spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
Treasured Diamond Mask of Legendary Vict.name: Treasured Diamond Mask of Legendary Victory

majorIds.Alter Ego: +Alter Ego: Awakened can be activated after saving 40% less mana, but its duration is reduced by 25%.

majorIds.Hawkeye: +Hawkeye: Condense Arrow Storm into a tight beam of 5 arrows per stream that deal 10%, 1%, and 1%.

Little Inferno.lore: It is cold to the touch until worn. Once donned, it engulfs the wearer in excruciatingly hot flames, but never shall the wearer burn; only their enemies will feel the pain of the fire.
Little Inferno.name: Little Inferno

Mask of the Spirits.lore: Not all who roam may find their way home. Others lose themselves in the world... And find a new way forward.
Mask of the Spirits.name: Mask of the Spirits

Butterfly.lore: "Time travel cares less about small things like a flapping wing, and more about big things, like becoming your own grandfather." -Martyn, Time Valley Resident
Butterfly.name: Butterfly

Boreal-Patterned Crown.lore: Engraved with the beauty and mystery of the boreal lights, this ornately-crafted crown is given only to those who have bested the Mistress of the Hive.
Boreal-Patterned Crown.name: Boreal-Patterned Crown

Inconceivably Deranged Paper Mask of Leg.lore: This cheap paper mask drawn in the likeness of Herbert von Legendary as he was having a complete nervous breakdown after having his life threatened by people who would not stop challenging him, is handed over in the ill-conceived hope of easing the murderous tendencies of those who have spent unnecessary amounts of time, broken the mold, gone even further beyond, pushed onward to prove that they will not stop, ultimately garnered an unhealthy obsession, and then came to blows in Doctor Legendary's house demanding further prizes all for the singularly unsettling and quite possibly sociopathic purpose of spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge. The inside has the names and addresses of multiple notable psychoanalysts written with a hastily-scrawled note from Doctor Legendary himself begging that you stop completing the Legendary Challenge and go get therapy before you do something to him that would constitute legal action against you.
Inconceivably Deranged Paper Mask of Leg.name: Inconceivably Deranged Paper Mask of Legendary Victory

Brise.lore: "With the hot, dry winds from the Roots and the cold, wet winds from Nesaak, these houses rot faster than you can blink." -Viraex, Elkurn Citizen
Brise.name: Brise

Iosis.lore: The last step towards purity. Dissolve and coagulate. Be anew.

majorIds.Temblor: +Temblor: Bash gains +1 Area of Effect and is 25% faster.

Iosis.name: Iosis

Pisces.lore: The oddly uncomfortable helmet was hand sculpted from a mystic clay found only in the depths of Molten Heights. Not much is known about the substance.
Pisces.name: Pisces

majorIds.Altruism: +Altruism: Nearby players gain 100% of the health you gain from Health Regen and Life Steal.

Revered Silver Mask of Legendary Victory.lore: This ornate decorative mask, fashioned from pure silver, is awarded to those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge and broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
Revered Silver Mask of Legendary Victory.name: Revered Silver Mask of Legendary Victory

Outrage.lore: \[Community Event Winner\] This battered stone mask is of unknown origin, and has no openings for the eyes whatsoever. Indeed, all that can be seen while wearing it is that which makes you truly angry.
Outrage.name: Outrage

majorIds.Geocentrism: +Geocentrism: Aura radiates from you instead of your Totem and can be cast any time.

Phoenix Prince's Crown.lore: The Phoenix Prince is a mythical figure spoken of in Avos legend. His crown cursed him in an endless cycle of death and rebirth.
Phoenix Prince's Crown.name: Phoenix Prince's Crown

majorIds.Escape Route: +Escape Route: Frenzy and Time Dilation charge twice as fast, but to a halved maximum.

Heliophilia.lore: This peculiar shawl is eternally warm to the touch, and shimmers brilliantly in the sunlight. It is rumored to give amazing health benefits and good fortune to those who wear it.
Heliophilia.name: Heliophilia

Propeller Hat.lore: A tag on the inside of the hat reads: "Do not fly during thunderstorms! The wearer is liable for all injuries sustained while using this product."

majorIds.Windsurf: +Windsurf: Righting Reflex has 75% reduced fall speed, lasts twice as long, and is affected stronger by movement speed.

Propeller Hat.name: Propeller Hat

Keratoconus.lore: The unearthly wood of eyestalk is durable, but with horrific cost. Pieces severed from the trunk continue to collect and cultivate the essence of abandoned eyes, and the unfortunate wearer becomes a catalyst for growth.
Keratoconus.name: Keratoconus

Nonexistence.lore: What lies beneath the brim of all that never was, that overflowing vastness which cannot spill?
Nonexistence.name: Nonexistence

Enhanced Salience.lore: Adding hard metal onto a religious cap seems blasphemous to you. The merchant disagrees.
Enhanced Salience.name: Enhanced Salience

Call of the Void.lore: Originating from the unspeakable dark land, looking into the helmet will show nothing but darkness. Wearing it is said to reverse your morality, as if it were draining your will to live into the void.
Call of the Void.name: Call of the Void

Cypress Amber.lore:
"Discernable by it's one-second glow, the cypress firefly makes it home amidst the ash of the upper heights, blending in with the fiery landscape."
 -Delinaed's Guide to Local Species, 2nd Edition.

majorIds.Perilous Flare: +Perilous Flare: Pyrokinesis moves much slower, but has an increased Area of Effect and  +50%.

Cypress Amber.name: Cypress Amber

The Berserker's Helm.lore: Worn by a terrible berserker during his fanatical rampage through the land, his rage permeates this horned blackiron helmet.
The Berserker's Helm.name: The Berserker's Helm

Taciturn.lore: The Expanse holds an exigent paranoia, a hamartia for even the most renowned heroes. Only a survivor knows to hoard intelligence, showing their hand only when none will be left to recount it.
Taciturn.name: Taciturn

Enhanced Umbrella Hat.lore: The only difference you can see is that a tacky logo for Rymek Armoury has been stenciled onto the top.
Enhanced Umbrella Hat.name: Enhanced Umbrella Hat

Blue Mask.lore: The Blue Mask's physical traits are equal to that of paper, but the mystical properties enhance the wearers personal skills tenfold. The mask is thought to originate from an ancient Dernel tribe.
Blue Mask.name: Blue Mask

Esteemed Bronze Mask of Legendary Victor.lore: This decorative mask, crafted of bronze alloys, is awarded only to those who have spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
Esteemed Bronze Mask of Legendary Victor.name: Esteemed Bronze Mask of Legendary Victory

Venerated Gold Mask of Legendary Victory.lore: This excessively ornate decorative mask, moulded from 24 carat gold, is awarded to those who have both spent an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge and broken the mold by continuing to spend an unnecessary amount of time completing the Legendary Challenge, and then gone even further beyond spending unnecessary amounts of time completing the Legendary Challenge.
Venerated Gold Mask of Legendary Victory.name: Venerated Gold Mask of Legendary Victory

Aries.lore: Two iron horns adorn this helmet to enhance the warriors of the Eradian, Dwarves who specifically rode Rams into battle at incredible speed.
Aries.name: Aries

Protector's Parable.lore: A wolf and a rabbit met in the woods. The rabbit was injured; the wolf spared it. The two grew close. One day, the rabbit fell into a hunter's trap. It was terrified, surrounded by armed men. The wolf burst from the trees, fighting the men back, even as they shot it with their bows, long enough for the rabbit to run away. It never saw the wolf again.
Protector's Parable.name: Protector's Parable

Ghostly Quasar.lore: An eerie glimpse into what once was, shining beautifully in the infinite expanse of the Void. As tragic a tale it is, perhaps it is better left a wisp.
Ghostly Quasar.name: Ghostly Quasar

Enhanced Assassin's Hood.lore: The chains comprising the mesh are rusty and old. It looks terrible, especially with the newer metal added on.
Enhanced Assassin's Hood.name: Enhanced Assassin's Hood

Necrosis.lore: 450 years ago a demonic plague like no other spread through Gavel, killing thousands. That is, until a priest encased the disease inside a helmet and warned everyone never to wear it.
Necrosis.name: Necrosis

Brainbleed.lore:
An otherwise healthy soldier once writhed and collapsed in the confines of an outpost. His autopsy was quickly canceled when military doctors noticed an unusually rapid spread of corruption in his corpse.
It's pulling towards something.
Brainbleed.name: Brainbleed

Fenmask.lore: This matted tangle of vines and marshland plants contains various herbal remedies woven into it. It is oddly comfortable, despite the thorns coating the inside.
Fenmask.name: Fenmask

requirements.quest: Realm of Light IV - Finding the Light

Clearsight Spectacles.lore: Ancient magicks are required to make these brilliant glasses, imbued with charity and selflessness. They allow sight beyond sight, rumoured to allow sight of a brilliant realm.
Clearsight Spectacles.name: Clearsight Spectacles

Blood Moon.lore: Imbued with the blood of the first werewolf, it was kept in Gelibord as a trophy before being stolen. Wearing it is said to mimic the effects of the lycanthropic curse.
Blood Moon.name: Blood Moon

Venison.lore: This ancient Elven sacrificial mask contains only a sliver of its previous magic, yet the blessing of the Elven god Entia still greatly empowers those who don it.
Venison.name: Venison

Gale's Sight.lore: True to their promise, these goggles were left as a memento for Ohms when his lover Gale finally died. Light as air, Gale's carefree nature lends itself to those who don them.
Gale's Sight.name: Gale's Sight

majorIds.Explosive Impact: +Explosive Impact: Your Exploding ID can trigger when hitting mobs with your Main Attack.

Scarlet Veil.lore: You're seeing red... Time to see more of it.
Scarlet Veil.name: Scarlet Veil

The Siren's Call.lore: “I have hope in me the likes of which you could never imagine, and despair the likes of which you shall never fathom. If I cannot satisfy the one, then I will indulge the other.”
The Siren's Call.name: The Siren's Call

majorIds.Pounce: +Pounce: Escape becomes a forward lunge.

Hero's Mask.lore: It bears the visage of a great hero. Thank you for participating in the Festival of the Heroes!
Hero's Mask.name: Hero's Mask

Resolution.lore: In the moments before an all but inescapable death, time slows down, and the pace of battle becomes yours. By mastering the escape, you can face death on command, reaping the benefits at will before the reaper reaches you.
Resolution.name: Resolution

Enhanced Hilltop.lore: Looks like it was hastily repainted to match the colors of the mesa. ...but you can see the original greens and browns underneath.
Enhanced Hilltop.name: Enhanced Hilltop

majorIds.Freerunner: +Freerunner: When your sprint bar is under 30% full, increase your sprint speed by +150%.

Third Eye.lore: The Bantisu monks have developed this enigmatic sigil in their years of meditation and study. It blesses the wearer with luck and powerful psionic ability.
Third Eye.name: Third Eye

Neolithic.lore: This ancient stone-hewn helmet is blended with the bones of an extinct animal of some kind. It is harder than dragon's hide.
Neolithic.name: Neolithic

Titanomachia.lore: This is futile, a fight against odds so great you may as well challenge the force of fate itself. Yet there is pride to be found in delaying the inevitable, so stand your ground and fight to the end.

majorIds.Dauntless Inferno: +Dauntless Inferno: Courage casts a series of 5 infernos that expand after the last, dealing 125% each, and grants 20% resistance instead of a damage boost.

Titanomachia.name: Titanomachia
